TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {6516=The California Walnut Board was established in 1948 to represent the walnut growers and handlers of California. The Board is funded by mandatory assessments of the handlers.The California Walnut Commission, established in 1987, is funded by mandatory assessments of the growers., 10852=Supportive but not conclusive research shows that eating 1.5 ounces of walnuts per day, as part of a low saturated fat and low cholesterol diet, and not resulting in increased caloric intake may reduce the risk of coronary heart disease. U.S. Food and Drug Administration, March 2004.}
textBeforeTable: Appetizers Course Lunch , Snack Meal 8 People Serves 10 Mins Active Time 60 Mins Cook Time 1 Hr, 10 Mins Total Time From the book Eating Well for Optimum Health by Andrew Weil, M.D. © 2000 by Andrew Weil, M.D. Published in arrangement with Alfred A. Knopf, a division of Random House, Inc. Drain the lentils and combine with the remaining ingredients in a food processor. Blend until smooth, adding water as necessary to achieve a spreadable consistency. Wash the lentils, cover with cold water, bring to a boil, and cook until soft, about 1 hour. Directions Salt and black or red pepper to taste 1 tablespoon red wine vinegar 2 teaspoons Dijon mustard 1/2 cup California walnuts, chopped 1 cup lentils, dry Ingredients Lentils and walnuts both contribute to the creamy texture of this savory spread. Enjoy it with vegetables or as a sandwich spread.
